title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Boeing targets 42-jet monthly output as 737 Max production ramps up
Ather Energy hits 5-lakh production milestone
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- Ather Energy rolled out its *500,000th* scooter — the **Rizta** — marking a major production milestone.
- The Rizta now accounts for over one‑third of Ather’s volumes as the company expands across *Middle* and *North India*, targeting tier‑II/III cities.
- To meet demand Ather is building *Factory 3.0* in Bidkin, Maharashtra, which will raise capacity from 420,000 to **1.42 million** units annually and adopt *Industry 4.0* technologies.

items.title: Ola Electric gets certification for rare-earth-free ferrite motor
items.summary:
- Ola Electric became the first Indian two-wheeler EV maker **certified** for its in-house *rare‑earth‑free ferrite motor*, passing AIS 041 performance and power tests.
- Testing found the *ferrite motor* matches rare‑earth permanent magnet motors for 7 kW and 11 kW variants, lowering costs and import dependency.
- The motor will be integrated across Ola’s lineup to improve *affordability*, sustainability, and supply‑chain resilience in India.

items.title: Eli Lilly to invest $1B+ in India to expand manufacturing
items.summary:
- Eli Lilly will invest *over $1 billion* in India to boost manufacturing and supply through **local contract manufacturers**, targeting drugs for *obesity, diabetes, Alzheimer's, cancer* and autoimmune conditions.
- It is opening a manufacturing and quality hub in **Hyderabad** to oversee its contract network, provide technical capabilities, and hire engineers, chemists and quality specialists.
- The expansion supports global capacity amid U.S. tariff-driven reshoring and rising demand after launches like *Mounjaro*, while facing competition from generics when *semaglutide* patents expire.

items.title: Synergy Capital buys Saurashtra Fuels’ Mundra coke plant in ₹2,000 crore bet on India’s steel sector
First commercial coal mine to be launched in Arunachal's Namchik-Namphuk today
Tanfac doubles solar‑grade DHF capacity to 10,000 TPA
items.summary:
- Tanfac has commissioned the second 5,000 TPA phase of its *Solar Grade DHF* plant, bringing total capacity to **10,000 TPA** after successful trial production and customer quality approvals.
- The company doubled output within 8–12 months and says it is the *first and only chemical company in India* to achieve this solar‑grade DHF capacity.
- Management expects the expansion to strengthen Tanfac's role in the *solar manufacturing* supply chain and to improve both top‑ and bottom‑line performance.

items.title: India in talks with Russia for five more S-400 systems
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- India and Russia are negotiating purchase or joint production of five additional **S-400** systems to strengthen long-range air defence ahead of President Putin's Dec 5 visit.
- Following the 2018 $5.43B deal (two of five due by end-2026), the new plan would buy three and manufacture two in India under *technology transfer*, with private-sector MRO roles.
- India is also considering Russian RVV-BD missiles for its *Su-30MKI* and has discussed Su-57s, while reports of S-500 purchases are incorrect.

items.title: Jindal Stainless launches ₹125-crore fabrication unit in Mumbai; targets 18,000 TPA capacity by FY27
Indian market's shift towards premium devices to drive Snapdragon 8 chipsets adoption: Qualcomm
Piyush Goyal and Sembcorp CEO discuss clean energy, hydrogen
items.summary:
- Union Minister *Piyush Goyal* met Kim Yin Wong, CEO of *Sembcorp*, to explore collaboration on *clean energy*, *green hydrogen*, industrial parks and skill development.
- The talks were part of Goyal's Singapore visit, including meetings with PM Lawrence Wong and investment leaders (GIC, Temasek) to boost FDI and partnerships.
- He highlighted India's renewable progress and pushed for deeper B2B ties to scale projects, skills and green investments.

items.title: US tariff threats push Indian pharma to diversify beyond generics, American market
JCBL Armouring Solutions breaks into India’s luxury car armouring segment
Atoms for atmanirbharta: The strategic role of nuclear energy in India’s growth story
DGCA probes RAT deployment on Air India Boeing 787
items.summary:
- The *DGCA* will probe after a Ram Air Turbine (*RAT*) automatically deployed on an Air India *Boeing* 787-8 during final approach to Birmingham.
- Boeing-recommended maintenance was completed with *no discrepancies* and all electrical and hydraulic parameters were normal, resulting in a *safe landing*.
- The aircraft has been released for service but remains subject to the DGCA's detailed investigation into the uncommanded *RAT* deployment.

items.title: JSW One Platforms raises ₹575 crore to expand tech and logistics for MSMEs
Former ArcelorMittal deal whiz Sudhir Maheshwari buys Gujarat met coke unit
E-waste worth ₹23 crore seized at Nhava Sheva Port
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- The *Directorate of Revenue Intelligence* seized *e-waste* worth ₹23 crore disguised as *aluminium scrap* at *Nhava Sheva* under *Operation DigiScrap*. 
- Officials recovered 17,760 old laptops, 11,340 mini/barebone CPUs and 7,140 processor chips from four containers and arrested the director of a *Surat-based* firm. 
- Import of such used electronics is banned under *FTP 2023* and the *E-Waste Rules 2022*, and seized goods will be re-exported or destroyed for violating *BIS* norms.

items.title: Competition heats up to challenge Nvidia's AI chip dominance
Firefly Aerospace to buy SciTec for $855M
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Firefly Aerospace will acquire national-security firm *SciTec* for about **$855 million**, funded with **$300M cash** and **$555M in shares**, closing by year-end.
- SciTec’s missile-warning, tracking, intelligence and surveillance software will be integrated into Firefly’s launch, lunar and in‑space services and will operate as a Firefly unit under CEO *Jim Lisowski*.
- The deal strengthens Firefly’s military-space prospects amid rising geopolitical tensions and follows a recent valuation near *$9.84 billion* after its Nasdaq debut.

items.title: China's chip challenge: The race to match US tech
New electronic component scheme to double local value addition to 40% over five years: Elcina
Altman seeks funds for OpenAI infrastructure abroad
items.summary:
- *Sam Altman* is touring East Asia and the Middle East to secure financing and manufacturing partners for *OpenAI*, meeting firms like *TSMC*, *Foxconn*, *Samsung* and *SK Hynix*.  
- *Samsung* and *SK Hynix* signed letters of intent to supply memory chips, and Altman is pushing suppliers for higher capacity and priority orders as compute spending is projected at *$16B* this year and up to *$400B* by 2029.  
- He plans investor meetings in the UAE to raise funds for infrastructure and research, though Reuters could not immediately verify the WSJ report.

items.title: Scindia hails young innovators in India's space boom
items.author: ANI
items.summary:
- Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia praised *young innovators* for using **space technology** in agriculture, education and other real‑world applications while congratulating winners of the Viasat: Space for Good India Challenge 2025.
- The national winner, Mayank Golechha (*MagnoSat*), proposed superconducting electromagnetic rings to accelerate satellites; runners‑up *Plasma Pathways* and *STELLAR* received cash prizes and mentorship.
- Industry and government bodies (Viasat, IN‑SPACe, DoT) pledged funds, mentorship and a supportive ecosystem to scale India‑centric space solutions and boost *STEM* careers.

items.title: India's services and manufacturing exports offer untapped potential for foreign investors: World Bank Chief Economist
NaMo Lab to boost India's chip design ecosystem
items.summary:
- The government approved the *NaMo Semiconductor Lab* at **IIT Bhubaneswar**, funded under MPLAD (Rs 4.95 crore) to equip the institute with design, training and fabrication tools.
- With Rs 4.6 crore for equipment and Rs 35 lakh for software, the lab will train industry‑ready talent and support *Make in India* and *Design in India* initiatives.
- Building on India's ~20% share of global chip‑design talent and SCL Mohali's student chips, the lab complements regional SiC and 3D glass packaging projects to strengthen the domestic semiconductor ecosystem.

items.title: Vedanta to invest ₹13,226 cr to boost aluminium capacity
items.summary:
- Vedanta will invest *₹13,226 crore* to raise aluminium capacity from **2.4 MTPA** to **3.1 MTPA** by *FY28*.
- The move makes *aluminium* central to Vedanta's growth, targeting **$8-10 billion EBITDA** by FY28, aided by captive integration and ~24% cost cuts.
- Rising domestic demand from *EVs*, *renewables*, urban infrastructure and govt initiatives underpins long-term demand and resilience.

items.title: Fears of massive battery fires spark local opposition to energy storage projects
Govt to set up 2000 MWh battery storage plant for solar power
items.summary:
- The government has floated tenders for a *2,000 MWh battery energy storage system (BESS)* in Rajasthan, adding to *4,000 MWh* already under development for a total of *6,000 MWh*.
- The MNRE approved a four‑hour battery cycle to charge during long solar-rich days and discharge during evening peak hours, aiming to supply cheaper *solar power* and reduce reliance on costlier exchange power.
- The state will map generation and consumption from grid-scale, rooftop and *Kusum* projects to optimise renewables and improve *grid stability*, with more storage capacity planned as needs crystallise.

items.title: PE majors eye minority stake in Romsons Group
items.summary:
- PE firms, including *Warburg Pincus* and *TA Associates*, are targeting a minority stake in Romsons for about **₹1,200 crore**, a marquee deal in medical consumables.
- Due diligence is ongoing and the deal may close in *2–4 weeks*; investors are drawn to Romsons’ low‑cost, high‑volume products (syringes, catheters, infusion sets) and 100+ country export network.
- The Agra family‑run group (founded 1952) leads in *critical care and diagnostics* supply, and the investment could accelerate its *global reach* and scale.

items.title: India's petrochemical push may tip Asia supply balance
items.summary:
- *India*'s rapid petrochemical capacity additions, following *China*, risk worsening *overcapacity* across Asia and intensifying competition, S&P warns.
- S&P highlights *USD 25 billion* in sticky public capex and *USD 12 billion* in flexible private plans; higher self‑sufficiency may weaken regional *exporters* and spur *consolidation*.
- Strong *domestic demand* means India could become the world's #2 *polyethylene* consumer, offering resilience despite structural headwinds.

items.title: Goodluck India joins bid for DRDO's AMCA programme
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- *Goodluck India* has signed a tripartite MoU with *BrahMos Aerospace (BATL)* and *Axiscades* to jointly bid for DRDO's *AMCA* fifth‑generation combat aircraft programme.
- The *AMCA* aims for a fifth‑generation *stealth* fighter with advanced avionics, super‑cruise, internal weapons bays and electronic warfare, with Goodluck offering defence‑grade manufacturing and high‑end forgings.
- Goodluck Defence secured an industrial licence to make medium‑calibre shells, the group has six plants (5 lakh tpa) and says the move supports *Atmanirbhar Bharat* and indigenous defence supply chains.

items.title: Socomec to invest $10M in new India factory
items.author: G Balachandar, Times of India
items.summary:
- Socomec will invest *$7–10M* to establish a leased greenfield *manufacturing* unit in India, evaluating southern and western locations to expand capacity. 
- The company, with two Gurgaon plants at full capacity, plans to lift *Make in India* output from ~50% to 70% as revenue heads past ₹1,000 crore, focusing on *data centers*, renewables, EV charging and BESS. 
- It allocates ~8% of turnover to *R&D* for high-efficiency products and is exploring acquisitions in *switching and monitoring* to broaden capabilities.

items.title: Piyush Goyal urges Singapore-based investors to explore opportunities in India
India's coffee exports rise 15% in Apr–Sep
items.summary:
- India's coffee exports rose *15%* in Apr–Sep FY26 to **$1.05 billion**, with shipments up *24%* year‑on‑year.
- In rupee terms exports climbed *19%* to **Rs 9,119.24 crore** and *per‑unit realisation* jumped *34%* to **Rs 4.71 lakh/tonne**, indicating stronger prices and value addition.
- Commerce Secretary promoted sustainability, diversification and *Brand India* at the Coffee Experience Zone, and officials eye *EFTA* markets (Switzerland, Norway, Iceland) for export growth.

items.title: India's ESDM market to double to ₹7-8L by 2030
items.summary:
- Report forecasts India's *ESDM* market will double to **₹7-8 lakh crore by 2030**, expanding at a *20–25% CAGR* driven by smartphones, consumer and automotive electronics.
- *Smartphones* are the backbone (62% of FY25); domestic manufacturing rose from 2 units in 2014 to 300+ in 2024, producing ~325–330M units with exports ~36%.
- Policy support (PLI, SPECS, ECMS, PMP) plus *AI, IoT, EV* trends are attracting investment and positioning India as a global electronics hub.

items.title: Union Minister Reddy to lay foundation stone for Arunachal coal project
D2C beauty brands like Sugar, Renee, Fae attract rising investor funding in 2025
DGTR launches probe into cheap stainless steel imports from China, Indonesia, Vietnam
GST 2.0 lapses: FMCG products spark blame game between companies & distributors
Soaring prices stall Dussehra gold rush, volume down 25% this year
Isabgol processors threaten to halt purchases from October 6 over GST issues
Nvidia and Fujitsu partner on AI, robots and infrastructure
items.summary:
- *Nvidia* and *Fujitsu* will build an *AI infrastructure* for Japan by 2030, combining Nvidia GPUs with Fujitsu’s local expertise.
- The partnership targets *AI robots*, digital twins and applications across health care, manufacturing and customer services, with potential collaboration with Yaskawa.
- Aim is a *humancentric* approach to ease Japan’s labor shortages and later scale solutions globally, though investment details were not disclosed.

items.title: Trump cancels billions in clean energy grants
Tharisa to invest $547M in underground platinum mine
items.summary:
- Tharisa will invest $547 million to convert its Bushveld open‑pit operation to *underground* mining over the next decade to extend its life‑of‑mine.
- The mechanised project targets first ore from one of two shafts in Q2 2026 and aims for steady‑state output of **200,000 oz** of PGMs and >2 million tonnes of chrome annually.
- The plan bets on sustained demand for *PGMs* from fuel cells and clean hydrogen despite EV pressures and complements a 226,000 oz/year Karo platinum project in Zimbabwe.

items.title: India recommends anti-dumping duty on Chinese solar cells
items.author: TOI Business Desk
items.summary:
- The Commerce Ministry's DGTR has recommended a *definitive anti-dumping duty* on imported **solar cells** from *China* for *three years* to shield domestic manufacturers.
- Suggested duties range from *23%* to *30%* of the CIF value for some Chinese firms, with the Finance Ministry to take the final decision.
- The measure aims to protect India's growing *renewable energy* supply chain and address the trade imbalance with *China*.

items.title: Govt may cancel 3-4 GW of solar tenders over import rules
items.summary:
- The government ordered clean‑energy agencies to cancel and reissue at least *3–4 GW* of solar tenders that were *rushed* to bypass the June 2026 local‑content rule.
- Agencies allegedly misused an exemption allowing bids by Aug 31, issuing some tenders with *7‑day* windows; they have *15 days* to report actions taken.
- Cancellations could delay projects, favour domestic manufacturers ahead of the policy and strain supplies until India is largely self‑sufficient by *March 2027*.

items.title: Socomec to invest $10M in new India factory
items.author: G Balachandar
items.summary:
- Socomec will invest *$7–10 million* to set up a leased greenfield **factory in India**, scouting southern and western locations to expand local production.
- Already running two Gurgaon plants at full capacity, it aims to raise *Make in India* output from ~50% to 70% and target growth in **data centers**, renewables, and EV charging.
- The company invests ~8% of turnover in R&D for *high-efficiency* compact products, and is exploring acquisitions in switching/monitoring and growth in *BESS*.

items.title: India issues 3.6 GW renewables tenders; 25 GW solar added
items.author: Saurav Anand, ET EnergyWorld
items.summary:
- India floated *3,628 MW* of renewable tenders in September — including a *1,000 MW* Deendayal Port solar bid, a *600 MW* ISTS wind bid by SJVN and Coal India's *3,000 MW* multi‑state solar EPC plan.
- From January–August India added *25,264 MW* solar and *4,517 MW* wind (total renewables ~*242.6 GW*), and a 600 MW solar+storage auction at Rewa awarded *ACME* and *Ceigall* 300 MW each.
- *USD 2,245 million* of investments entered renewables in September, Green DAM traded *994 million units* (avg Rs 4.04/unit), module prices were stable and multiple policy notifications were issued.

items.title: TCS hiring, cybersecurity moves under US, UK lens
items.author: Veena Mani, TNN
items.summary:
- US Senators Grassley and Durbin pressed TCS CEO K Krithivasan over hiring after Jacksonville layoffs, noting TCS got approval for *5,505 H-1B visas* in FY2025 and faces an *EEOC* probe into alleged replacement of older American workers.
- UK MP Liam Byrne sought answers about TCS's role in cyber incidents at *Jaguar Land Rover, M&S,* and *Co-op*, citing BBC reports a ransomware email was allegedly sent using a TCS employee account.
- Combined scrutiny targets TCS's *hiring practices* and *cybersecurity controls*, posing reputational and regulatory risks across the *US* and *UK*.
